intro: Mesembryanthemum lepidum, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well-adapted to drought conditions. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to hot, dry climates. Mesembryanthemum lepidum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
